posts.post_content:
She gives Razia a run for her money.  
But why bit them against ech other when can you use BOTH?  
They work decent toghether actually. Gisela yield Razia that she NOT made of cardboard (duh) and Razia's can actually smack meanies on another side of the board for a whooping six!  
  
Also it's note worthy that her first ability is kinda political in multiplayer, with opponents smacking each other for double damage.  
  
It's nice knowing that with that angel lady and [Slayer's Stronghold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slayer's Stronghold) (and mabe, mabe other shinies in Return to Ravnica?) Boros can hit a buck once again.

Posted By: Cloudeye (5/19/2012 7:12:20 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
EDIT: Having just drafted a Gisela last week, I feel I must say-  
HOLY CRAP.  
She won me a game where I was at 4 life, and my opponent at almost 30.  
Needless to say, that guy *hated* her... and I fell in love.  
  
She'll make for a *great* Boros General-  
her only real drawback is vulnerability to removal,  
which can be compensated for with [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) or the like.  
  
Then, add [Hostility](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hostility) and cast [Comet Storm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Comet Storm)-  
A horde of 6/2 Hasted Elementals is likely to end the game rather quickly.  
  
Also, I \*really\* want to run her with [Mirror Gallery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Gallery) and [Infinite Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infinite Reflection),  
just to make the game impossible to play without a calculator.
posts.html:

Needless to say, that guy hated her... and I fell in love.

She'll make for a great Boros General-
her only real drawback is vulnerability to removal,
which can be compensated for with Lightning Greaves or the like.

Then, add Hostility and cast Comet Storm-
A horde of 6/2 Hasted Elementals is likely to end the game rather quickly.

Also, I *really* want to run her with Mirror Gallery and Infinite Reflection,
just to make the game impossible to play without a calculator.

Posted By: drpvfx (5/25/2012 11:42:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: What I love about Gisela is that she feels a LOT like [Teferi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=244667). Not so much in the sense of the effects, but more so on their effect on the game. Not only do they give you a distinct advantage over your opponent, but they also create an equally proportional disadvantage for the opponent. Is it exactly *fair*? Not necessarily, but it's not *broken*, and that's why Gisela and Teferi are mythic. Cards like Gisela and Teferi define what a mythic should be—not completely broken, but enough to give you that necessary upper hand.
posts.html:
What I love about Gisela is that she feels a LOT like Teferi. Not so much in the sense of the effects, but more so on their effect on the game. Not only do they give you a distinct advantage over your opponent, but they also create an equally proportional disadvantage for the opponent. Is it exactly fair? Not necessarily, but it's not broken, and that's why Gisela and Teferi are mythic. Cards like Gisela and Teferi define what a mythic should be—not completely broken, but enough to give you that necessary upper hand.

posts.post_content:
Everyone is pointing out the combo with [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia), but no-one has mentioned another card from the same Commander deck as her that combos great with Gisela. [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia). Get both on the table and it's "R: Pyrohemia deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature they control, and no damage to you or your creatures".  
  
Edit: ClowWizardEriol, the damage prevented is rounded up. Rounding up 1/2 a point of damage prevented equals 1 point of damage prevented, thus she prevents all the damage [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia) would deal to you and creatures you control.
posts.html:
Everyone is pointing out the combo with Kaalia, but no-one has mentioned another card from the same Commander deck as her that combos great with Gisela. Pyrohemia. Get both on the table and it's "R: Pyrohemia deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature they control, and no damage to you or your creatures".

Edit: ClowWizardEriol, the damage prevented is rounded up. Rounding up 1/2 a point of damage prevented equals 1 point of damage prevented, thus she prevents all the damage Pyrohemia would deal to you and creatures you control.

Posted By: Saikuba (5/16/2012 11:49:56 PM)

posts.post_content:
@BorosGeneral   
Though in this case, the lack of double-strike makes her a card WotC is willing to make, and 2x damage first strike is BETTER than double-strike, in my opinion.  
  
And I actually think the second ability is the better one, since it helps buy you time, and, as mentioned before, in multiplayer formats it forces players to think twice about attacking you when you take half and they take double, and instead choose to attack for double on another person preemptively.  
  
Also, I love how she's around the same power level as BS angel, maybe better, and yet there is nowhere **near** the levels of rage that BS got...
posts.html:
@BorosGeneral
Though in this case, the lack of double-strike makes her a card WotC is willing to make, and 2x damage first strike is BETTER than double-strike, in my opinion.

And I actually think the second ability is the better one, since it helps buy you time, and, as mentioned before, in multiplayer formats it forces players to think twice about attacking you when you take half and they take double, and instead choose to attack for double on another person preemptively.

Also, I love how she's around the same power level as BS angel, maybe better, and yet there is nowhere near the levels of rage that BS got...

posts.post_content:
So this is the deck idea:  
  
gisela, [dragon arch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dragon arch), [spitemare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=spitemare), [stuffy doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=stuffy doll), [defiler of souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=defiler of souls), [kaervek the merciless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=kaervek the merciless), [shivan meteor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=shivan meteor), [seething song](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=seething song), [geosurge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=geosurge), [reverberate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reverberate)s.  
  
She just took the place of some risky enchantments and added the badass dragon arch ploy.
